reviews.title: Competitive Pricing, Fastest Payouts, Reliable Support = Top Tier Firm
reviews.content: I've had a great experience with MyFundedFutures so far and decided they deserved a review. Their prop account pricing is some of the most competitive in the industry—definitely more affordable compared to other firms offering similar setups. What really stands out, though, is their payout speed. In my experience, they’ve been the fastest in the industry—super efficient and always on time.Customer support is also reasonably fast and helpful. While there’s always room for improvement, they’re responsive and usually get back to you in a timely manner with clear answers.Overall, if you’re looking for a prop firm that balances affordability, quick payouts, and solid support, MyFundedFutures is worth checking out.

reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic support from…
reviews.content: Absolutely fantastic support from Emmanuel at MyFundedFutures!I had some confusion regarding the contract size limits during my evaluation, and Emmanuel went above and beyond to clarify everything in detail. I truly appreciated his clear and patient explanation, especially regarding the difference between per-position limits and daily volume.It’s rare to receive such quick and friendly support in this industry, and Emmanuel made the experience smooth and stress-free. Thanks to his help, I now fully understand the platform’s rules and feel confident moving forward.Thank you again, Emmanuel — you’ve been a huge help, and I’m grateful for your professionalism!Highly recommend MyFundedFutures — great service and even better people.

reviews.title: DO NOT BUY ACCOUNTS FROM THIS FIRM.
reviews.content: DO NOT BUY ACCOUNTS FROM THIS FIRM.There are problems every single day. my funded accounts reject orders they fix it after a few hours just for me to enter a trade then it rejects in the trade and I blow the account. This firm is ridiculous and when I asked for compensation or a reset on my funded they refused even though they acknowledged that the orders were rejecting. Stay away I thought after a few months they would fix this stupid firm but nope. Also live data does not work. They say that if you want live data you need to buy the subscription on trading view I have it and it works but anytime I connect to my tradovate account there's a delay as well every new candle takes about 10-15 seconds sometimes longer to show up. It's not my internet because other firms work perfectly fine. This firm just robs you.

reviews.title: MFFU will pay until you start to make too much money then they will ban you!
reviews.content: MFFU will pay until you start to make too much money then they will find a reason not to pay you and ban you. On my 10th $1200 payout from 50k Starter accounts they scheduled a compliance call with me. After the call which I struggled as I am not fluent in English but yet I demonstrated my trading platform and how I operate they accused me of not owning the account and denied my payout and banned me from the platform. Great they were very happy to take my credit card payments. Careful with this company they will pay you until your account gets flagged as a high expense then they will find a reason to deny and ban you!

reviews.title: Today I was blown away
reviews.content: Today I was blown away. Not by a win, loss, or break even day but by customer service. As a new My Funded Futures customer, I experienced initial technical issues with my evaluation account. I've heard great things about MFF and wanted to try them for myself. There was a moment when I was experiencing this technical difficulty, that I believed I've chosen the wrong prop firm to trade/partner with. However, with the assistance of my customer service rep Shadd, my worries were put to rest. I contacted Shadd, with my issue, and in a matter of 5 minutes...YES 5 minutes, customer service responded to my inquiry and provided me with the solution I sought. This was incredible response time and the faster I can recall receiving from any company, not just prop firms. If partnering/trading with My Funded Futures runs as smoothly as their customer service, then MFF has a customer/trader/partner for the forseeable future.

reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed After Getting Funded
reviews.content: I passed the $50K evaluation phase trading the gold futures contract (GCN5), and their platform never gave any warnings or restrictions. After getting funded, I traded the same contract again  just a 1-lot  and suddenly my account got breached at a gold price that never even occurred on the charts (they claimed $3,505, while gold was around $3,335).When I reached out to support, they simply blamed me for using the "wrong contract" and refused to reinstate my account or offer any compensation. What’s worse, they shut down the chat mid-conversation and told me not to raise any more tickets.If this contract wasn’t valid, why did the platform let me use it all throughout the evaluation and even during funding?This feels like a serious lack of transparency, and honestly, it doesn’t give much confidence in their integrity. I hope others read this before risking time and money here.

reviews.title: BS Blown Account
reviews.content: Although there was a couple issues that was kinda annoying to start with, none compared to how I basically felt booted off the platform. I signed up last Friday since writing this, the war news happened over that weekend. The market opened Sunday Pm and I over traded no doubt. I hit my 50% drawdown, which I didn’t know locked my account (I messed up no big deal) I was on support for about 3 hours Monday morning trying to figure out why none of my trades are going through. After someone finally got to me they told me my account was locked because of the drawdown. I asked if I was going to be able to trade Asia open or have to wait until NY open they said that I’ll be able to trade by end of the day. Not really sure what that entailed but I was tired of being on support and at least I knew why I couldn’t trade. Then comes 3pm (market opens again for my time) I decided to open trading view when running errands and see if any trades go through. I hit sell, nothing happens, hit it a couple more times still nothing happens, no trades are going through. I closed it thinking I’ll jus have to wait until tomorrow. Then comes 6pm I log into trading view and notice my log in to tradovate doesn’t work. I log into MFFU dashboard and see that I have to reset my account. At this point I’m dumbfounded because idk what happened. I immediately go to support again, and it took about 6 hours to get a response (I contacted both their email and chat log on their website) both basically said “oh your account is blown, you have to pay to reset it”. this genuinely irritated me because well I didn’t blow it. About a day later someone else picked up the email thread of my complaint and checked that the same day (Monday) I had placed 2 trades and lossed 1000$. This how I knew it was bs bc my average trade I never losses more than 300$ so I assumed that trading view placed the trades and the platform glitched out. After a couple days, although I hated the situation and hated the little support I got, I really enjoyed being able to take trades on trading view so I pulled a little money from my savings and tried to reset my account. Except the website wouldn’t let me link my debit card again. Then I tried my credit card and cash app card and those all wouldn’t get accepted. This truly is probably a 1-1000 situation but damn did it hurt to have my experience cut so short with them.

reviews.title: 50k Expert, declined payout, the worst prop firm in industry
reviews.content: 50k Expert, most of the prop firms have the 30day inactivity rule, but not here, here you have 7 days not even trading days, but a calendar days. I was on holidays, traded after 9 days, i asked the discord support they said that it's a hard breach with inactivity and immediately you are receiving an email, which I never did, asked support if my account is still active they assured me it is. Then made 2,2k wanted to get a payout and they said i didn't trade so i breached the inactivity rule, if i didn't write to them specifically with this inactivity rule they would probably pay me out without any issues, but yeah instead of giving me after over half a month an email after inactivity breach, they decided to deactivate account when it came to payout.It's crazy that they want a 1 star review instead of fixing an critical issue, giving me an notice that if i won't trade then it will be disabled.Literally the worst prop firm in the whole industry.

reviews.title: I just started an evaluation with…
reviews.content: I just started an evaluation with MyFundedFutures and so far it seems like a great company to work with to try to build capital via futures trading. The rules aren't complicated and there's only a few and the cost is good considering they don't have an activation fee that has to be paid if you do pass the evaluation, like most of the other trader funding firms.Also, the customer service has been great so far. I emailed support to ask some question about getting my account set up at 11:30pm US central time on a Sunday night and Caramel got back to me very quickly and was great at walking me through the process of getting my data feed turned on for the CBOT, NYMEX and COMEX markets.I had a couple questions that I needed clarification on the next day too, and I just emailed Caramel directly, since she was so nice to work with and again she got back to me right away and got my questions answered quickly. I learned about MFF from ImanTrading (on YouTube) and as of right now, I've been very happy with my experience with the company.

I am grateful for the kind and understanding support I recieved and would highly recommend MFFU to other traders after this experience.

reviews.title: I’ve only heard positive reviews about MFF
reviews.content: My Funded Futures has a clean interface and was recommended by someone I trust, as a reputable and reliable prop firm that actually pays out unlike some of the stories I’ve heard about others! In fact I think the whole space in general is a minefield but only ever heard positive reviews or MFF. To be clear, I haven’t yet passed my eval nor had any payouts myself but so far the experience has been perfect. I needed to have Nymex oil (CL) and Comex gold (GC) activated on my account, which I found out after emailing their customer support when I was wasn’t able to open any trades for those instruments. The responses I received were very quick (same afternoon), comprehensive and resolved my query perfectly. The support agent who handled my query from start to finish was called Davi and was just brilliant; friendly and helpful - and left me with a positive feeling towards the company which is why I’m taking the time to write this. Thank you Davi, I wish you all the best. I’ll also update this review if I can, once I’ve managed to get funded & paid out.

reviews.title: Misleading EOD Drawdown — Rules not honored
reviews.content: I subscribed to the Expert 50K plan at MyFundedFutures based on the conditions advertised on their website:Daily Loss Limit: $0Trailing Max Drawdown: $2,000Drawdown Mode: EOD (End of Day)According to their public explanation, the trailing drawdown is evaluated at the end of the trading day, and there is no daily loss limit. However, my account was disqualified in the middle of the day, even while I had an open trade in profit, simply because my equity (not my realized balance) temporarily dipped below their internal limit.When I asked for clarification, support informed me that the drawdown is monitored continuously during the day, and that any intraday breach—even unrealized—leads to termination, despite no such rule being published anywhere in the plan description.This contradicts the EOD logic they promote, and in my opinion, this qualifies as misleading advertising. Traders trust these firms to publish clear, transparent, and enforceable rules, especially when real money is involved. Unfortunately, MyFundedFutures applies internal rules not reflected in their public documentation.I do not recommend this firm to other traders until they correct their public materials or become transparent about their real enforcement policies.

reviews.title: Promotional price vs. validity..
reviews.content: I'm at first time user at My funded futures. I can only leave a review on my experience on purchase and promotion. The details of a promotion could provide more clarity on not just the price but validity of the promotion.For example, the said promotion is three free resets per 3 users, until a given promotion date.There is no stipulation on how long the resets would be valid after the promotional offer. Kyle at customer service online chat work with me to find clarification, as it was clear that he did not completely understand what I was asking or simply didn't know. however, after some time he returned with the answer I was hoping for; The expiration was not the same as promotion expiration.Quote:"Kyle . 1m agoIf you purchase a account and you receive 1free reset, it will stay on your account untilyou use it or passed the evaluation."I've heard pretty good things about this company as they are one of the leading prop firms out there, so I thought I would give them a try. I'm happy to come back and give them another star and for the review. I'm glad Kyle was patient to understand my concerns, has that will be a consideration if I'm going to purchase another two accounts.

reviews.title: My Funded Futures is my favorite prop!!
reviews.content: I can’t speak highly enough about My Funded Futures. As a long-time customer, I’ve consistently been impressed by their outstanding support team. Whenever I’ve encountered a challenge, their responses have been prompt, reasonable, and solution-focused, something that truly sets them apart in the prop firm space. Unlike some competitors who can be slow to respond or less helpful, My Funded Futures consistently delivers quick and reliable support. As a Funded Trader on multiple firms, this is abundantly important to me! Their payout system is also second to none. In many cases, I’ve received my payouts within minutes of submitting a request, an experience that’s worlds apart from other firms where I’ve waited up to two weeks.A huge thank-you to the amazing support team members who’ve helped me along the way—Dave, Emmanuel, Nate, Caramel, and many others. Your dedication has made all the difference!

reviews.title: Just signed up with a 50k starter. Murphy from Support was fantastic. Great Support. 50k Starter Account is one of the best products in the Futures Prop Space.
reviews.content: I just signed up for a 50k starter account with a great coupon code for my first account. I had issues with live data on my Tradovate after signing the agreements. But Murphy from Support was fantastic and solved the issues in 1-2 minutes max. This is a great start. I have just placed first trades and it was very fast with no latency, a profitable trade as well.I like the price with the no activation fee, by far one of the best offers in the futures prop space. Also, more drawdown than other firms, not that I would want to use it, but good for peace of mind. I actually like the 3 contract limit for the 50k, I feel this firm encourages good risk management practices and minimizes enabling traders to overleverage. I have been trading futures with props for 1.5 years and have had some success. But I wish I joined MFFU sooner, got caught up in FTT drama, and other lesser, not so great props. From the early days of my first account here, I wish I traded here instead throughout that time. But better late than never.I look forward to my future with this prop firm. Great support and great products!

reviews.content: The support specialist Kyle was great. There's only so much the specialist can do with what the company allows. There are some minor technical issues that MFF needs to work through. I was never told I couldn't reset my sim account after 30 days of failing. it was very misleading to have a reset button still available on sim accounts I wanted to reset and apparently they were just past the 30 days by a day or so. I still have yet to find this rule in the fine print and I asked for a link to it and didn't get it. Over all MFF is a great company it's just little stuff like this that really turns me off especially when they don't allow they staff to compensate for company oversights.

reviews.content: My 150k expert account was cancelled by MFF without explanation.  It also so happened to be an account I was paying $357.75 a month for instead of the $477 dollars they normally charge since I got it on sale.  They keep telling me I cancelled it even though I have provided support with proof that I didn't cancel my subscription.  The platform is decent, but the support is very non-hepful up to this point. If anything changes, I will update my score, but for now they have given me the run around.  Updated:  I am updating to a 1 star review, because the support is just that poor.  I've talked to 4 lower tier support people and no one seemingly wants to escalate my ticket to the next tier of support.  Update 2:  Gabrielo and Hannah, higher level support, was able to rectify the issue I had so the customer service is back on point.

reviews.content: In my opinion, this is the best futures prop firm on the market. Aside from the 2% limit that prevents you from trading an asset once it's reached I don't see any downsides. The customer service is truly amazing, the challenge is relatively easy to pass and most importantly, there are no activation fees after passing the evaluation.As for trading DxFeed does the job very well — the data feed almost never lags and I've never experienced any slippage, even during periods of high volatility which is not the case with other futures prop firms.

reviews.title: I won a coupon code for a 50k account…
reviews.content: I won a coupon code for a 50k account and was successfully able to put it in, bringing the cost to 0.00. Upon submission there was some kind of failure (likely related to 2000 people all trying to do the same thing) - not allowing payment to go through. I was denied the account even though I was successful in applying the coupon before the others. There are no issues with my bank or card. This morning's experience was completely unacceptable and likely a bait and switch, with lack of customer service and an answer of "the coupon code was applied successfully so we cannot help" - when other members are bragging about their 10-12 accounts they were able to scalp during this giveaway. Not a good look folks.

reviews.title: Broken account and 'fix'
reviews.content: As soon as I got the account it was just a S*** show, could access the account 'due to inactivity' couldn't get live data due to subscription, no stats would show, it would close trades no where near anything then 'auto liquidate' despite being no where near drawdown (I had a starter plus so no daily loss) but still somehow hit that? Contacting support the final time I got 'Kindly be aware that MyFundedFutures, emphasizes that we are not responsible or liable for any platform issues encountered. There is an agreement signed before account purchase, where the trader must agree that MyFundedFutures is not liable for the platform issues.' So they will tell you its fixed then you'll have the same issues, I'm sure I was just unlucky with an account but granted I didn't get much help, I ended up blowing the account due to the closing trades and daily limit which I never had but the account did. In all I spent more time on the support page than actually trading and was told it wasn't their problem as it was the programs yet they create the settings for the account. Funny that.Not going for a reset if I encounter issues again its not their fault id rather pay more money from the get go and get some actual help with fixing the issues that will effect trading.I would never go back to this company because it feels like they don't care if there were issues flooding the account which IS THEIR issue not the program I'm trading on.

reviews.title: Excellent Prop Firm Experience
reviews.content: Excellent Prop Firm ExperienceI've tried a few prop firms in the past, but this one easily stands out as my favorite. From the beginning, the signup process was smooth and the challenge rules were fair and transparent. What I really appreciate is their tight spreads, minimal slippage, and the fact that they allow traders to use EAs and trade news events — something not all firms are flexible with.Customer support is responsive and genuinely helpful, whether it’s about account setup or payout queries. Speaking of payouts, they’re fast and hassle-free, which builds a lot of trust.Another major plus is the educational content and trader dashboard — it's clean, informative, and helps me stay on track with my performance goals.If you're a serious trader looking for a reliable and trader-friendly prop firm, I highly recommend giving this one a shot.

reviews.title: Terrible service
reviews.content: I signed up for a starter evaluation account. Started trading the NQ US open. Placed a trade and the priced moved straight trough my targets without closing the trades. I had to go into Tradeovate and manually close out the trades. By that time, price moved in opposite direction. and then closed out at my stop losses. I reached my DLL for the day. I raised a ticket on the website, and the service agent by the name of Miracle picked up my ticket. He asked for videos of the trade which i did not have, but gave hime a pdf copy of the trades from tradeovate. After waiting for him to review the document which took him over an hour, he says that no one else had problems and it was probably my internet that was an issue. I have fibre superfast internet, so its not that. They did not offer to remove the trades that had an issue. very bad customer service compared to other firms out there.

reviews.title: Myfundedfutures is not what they claim
reviews.content: Myfundedfutures is a company that claims to want to help traders become profitable, but that is the farthest from the truth. They only want your money, and then they cancel your account for no reason, and then when you ask why, they just say, oh sorry. The claim was I would get a discount as long as I kept my account open, but then they canceled my account and would not give me the discount.  Better options out there for sure.

reviews.title: Once Qualified They Will Make You Lose Accounts (Server Issues)
reviews.content: First of all I just want to say I successfully trade 5 funded Topstep accounts, 7 Apex Funded with no problems whatsoever with those firms.  I used TradingView (via Tradovate to book trades).   I decided to diversify my accounts by buying some MFFU Expert.   I have so far qualified 3 150K expert accounts trading properly with consistent risk.  As soon as the account was funded, within a few trades on 'live' the trades fail to book, or double book.   When this happens it is not possible to connect (even in Tradovate).  The first time this happened I put it down to bad luck.  Now I just lost my third funded account.  The MFFU servers are clearly manipulated do either hang, double book, or refuse connection once funded.  I do NOT get any of these issues from the same PC trading through TradingView on Topstep nor Apex.   The technical support refuse to listen to reason and say it is not their problem.  Bearing in mind with MFFU expert account you are paying a very large amount upfront.   I would strongly recommend you use the other companies who are well established.  MFFU have only been around 2 years (Since 2022), so I will avoid.     They are definitely scamming people.

reviews.title: Vague scalping rule designed to deny payouts!
reviews.content: It looks like MFF has deliberately kept the scalping rule vague in order to use this to deny payouts. I askes a simple YES or NO question, but their response was dissapointing. How hard is it to define their rules clearly? I fear they would deny payouts after spending soo much for accounts. I hope I'm wrong.Me:"Regarding microscalping, once a trade moves in my direction and If I move my SL to just above my entry point and SL is hit frequantly, would it be considered as micro scalping?"   MFF Response: "Please note that any account reviews including micro scalping checks are always done by our Risk Team and approved by a Risk Manager at MyFundedFutures.This happens when a trader passes a challenge or when a payout is requested."

reviews.title: Banned me for absolutely no reason and…
reviews.content: Banned me for absolutely no reason and told me that its due to bot activity, when asked for evidence or show me where, they denied, and not willing to provide any other details. I can 100% guaranteed the all the trades were taken by me. They wouldn't give proper reasoning, or explanation. SO CAREFUL if you are getting an account from them. Kindly stick with trustable firms. AND PLESE DONT go with these guys.I can provide my chat transcript here."Hi Soruban!﻿I'm Ike, part of the MyFundedFutures Support Team. I'm here to assist you with any questions or concerns. Let me know how I can help!I can confirm that you have recently been in communication with a representative from the risk department. I am sorry but the decision of the risk department is definite and final. We we will appreciate your understanding on the matterBut i need a proper explanationI have spend so much here, in the hope to get my funded account and able to withdraw profits, suddenly, restricting me without a valid reasoning seems really unfair.like are there any trades placed by a bot?because I can prove that I only placed all the trades, using tradingview and sometimes tradovate due to the tradingview delaysShow me ONE trade that was made by a botI should have listened to the reviews and stick with TakeProfitTraders or Apex at lease they will give a proper explanation, it was my mistake to trust a firm that ban customers without a valid reasoningThank you for being an awful firmProfile image for IkeIke • 5m agoAfter consulting with a higher authority, we regret to inform you that the decision is final and cannot be reversed.We truly understand your concern and sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding. While we are unable to make any changes in this matter, we genuinely wish you the best in your future endeavors.If there’s anything else we can assist you with, please don’t hesitate to reach out!I hope you continuously ban even the funded traders so you can make money and they cant withdrawThank you for providing me with 0 reason, 0 evidence for bot activity, and banning me for absolutely no reason. except a scamming reasoningabsolutely an amazing firm"

reviews.title: Banned by following FAQ
reviews.content: MFFU has really been great for a while, but I've learned today that they don't stand by their own policies. I created a strategy in TradingView to automate my entries, stoploss, and take profits, all based on specific key levels. It also helps calculate risks instead of just guessing how many contracts to enter. My trades are only being entered during NY Market Hours when Im at the computer and watching the markets/trades. Myself and others have been getting banned on their platform for doing this.Per their policy and faq, they allow "Semi-Automated Trading"."- Semi-Automated Trading: This is permissible under the condition that traders actively monitor, manually manage, and understand the system and semi-automation's purpose."I reached out to their customer support and was advised that entries and exits must still be manual. Even though this logic doesn't constitute "Semi-Automated", this is just manual trading. But what they want isn't stated in their FAQ, so how/why should anyone be punished for it if what you want contradicts what the FAQ says?

reviews.title: They owned their mistake.
reviews.content: Edit:  2/25/2025 - A few weeks or so after this incident, the Operations Manager, Fabio, contacted me, apologized, and compensated me for their mistake.  That's all I can ask.  Updated from 1 star.------I will bullet point summarize this because I know your time is valuable. No on likes to read blocks of text and I want you to read this.  Key Points:- I'm not new to trading or prop firms and did my research and read their website thoroughly.- I trade micro BTC contracts- Their page (currently) says that you can trade 3 mini or 30 micro contracts on the Starter plan. (no exception)- NO WHERE on their entire website (for the time being) does it specify a difference for BTC contracts.- SURPRISE! BTC contracts are special and don't apply to this rule so you can only trade 3 mini contracts.- Emmanuel (Customer Support) confirmed that this info IS NOT specified on their website. (I have the chat)- I asked for some form of compensation because their website does not specify any of this.- My ticket was then escalated, and my account was breached (in profit) and my money refunded by the Manger, Hannah.- The reason given was I violated their "guidelines for respectful communication" because I told them (and I quote) "This is a one star review" (can't make this stuff up).*** This is incompetence at best.  Magnified by failure to admit their mistake and do the right thing.  What else did they "forget" to put on their website? ***

reviews.content: In the beginning it was good, then change of structure happened. During my time I had received payouts and done well as an ambassador and affiliate for them, Gabrielo took over as Head of Customer relations and started refusing payouts and acknowledging concerns and questions. As of yesterday my accounts were unable to trade the alloted contract size and when confronted about that I was informed to place a trade with max lots to ensure it took effect, I did so but during that time I had taken a loss and asked them to revert/cancel this trade as i was instructed to do so, today I got an email informing me that I was banned and permanently removed from using their services. There are better firms out there and better opportunities to make money, choose wisely and avoid the power hungry environment.

reviews.title: Not Dependable.
reviews.content: Was happy at the onset, however, they decided to ban me for something I never did. They alleged that I used the same device to access two separate MFFU accounts, which never happened. For "privacy reasons" they said they couldn't tell me who the other user was when I asked. To this day I have no clue what happened, but to me it seems like they wanted to keep me from getting payouts, as it happened the day after I withdrew. Having no ability to escalate or challenge the allegation is ridiculous. I wouldn't recommend going with them when there are better options. Yes the rules are easier and they are at a good price point, but if you want to truly build a future and relationship with a firm, this isn't it.

reviews.title: Scammers: You must be INVITED to become Funded
reviews.content: Do NOT use this prop firm, go to topstep. MyFundedFutures claims to give you funding once you hit your profit target, however, you only become a sim funded account at that point. You must be INVITED to become a full funded account, and those requirements are not released to you. Also, once you set an account to not auto-renew, you CANNOT change it to renew. it will close the account no matter what. Every reset you buy on the account after that is meaningless, because it will close the account at the renewal date no matter what.They can effectively never let you become funded and you will continue to pay them monthly. STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY.

reviews.content: I am writing this post to report my tremendous indignation at @MyFundedFutures. They have charged me several times on my credit card, exceeding my credit limit.In addition to the inconvenience of exceeding my credit limit, the next charge only happened because I asked my bank to cancel one of the purchases, freeing up space for them to charge me again for what was supposed to be just one bill.They did not release the account immediately after charging my card for this new charge. It took 14 days for the account to be inactive after payment was made, and it was only released because I had to keep asking their support team, as if I was begging for something.After it was released, I used the table for 1 day and they closed my account again. Why? They said I could not have filed a dispute with the bank, and I was only able to pay the assessment because they had used up the entire credit limit on my card due to THEIR mistake.Days have passed and I am still inactive. The fee for the last charge on my card will be due tomorrow, and I was only able to use the assessment for ONE day.In short, due to an error in your system, I will have to pay for an assessment that I was not even able to use. I had all the hassle with several emails and some totally unprepared, arrogant and lazy employees.Is it right to treat a partner like this? I don't think so!

They respond quickly, I was treated with respect (I'm new to prop firms and how they operate) and vitally, I was taken at my word when that was required. Shout out to Nathan in support for handling my queries in a timely and professional manner and for doing it with a good vibe. If you're new to prop firms, you'll likely be grateful for good support.All in all, a really good firm with the best evaluation parameters I could find, wide platform choice, good community, great support. Go for it and best of luck!

reviews.title: MFFU is the Real Deal
reviews.content: I wanted to receive my first payout prior to leaving a review. MFFU's rules are really, really straightforward. I received my first payout today. It took a few months for me to become a profitable trader with MFFU. Along the way I had some questions and issues and they addressed them in a reasonable time. Most recently, I dealt with Emmanuel regarding the payout process and he gave me the information I needed. No matter which rep you deal with, they will get you an adequate answer (I have dealt with multiple reps).Update: I lost the account with over $80k in profit because I broke the news trading rule. They do not have an area of where a trader can find all the relevant information in a consolidated area (like a contract).  I am ineligible to receive any of the profits because the account is gone. Typically other prop firms allow you to trade 1 min after news but it is 2 mins at MFFU. Knocking it down a couple of stars but besides that is ok.

There was a tech issue that initially meant I couldn’t access the funded account. So I contacted support expecting it to take a day or two and got on with trading the other funded accounts I have. After I finished trading I checked my email and found a response from Stephanie. She was very polite and friendly and to my surprise had already fixed the issue! I can’t say anything bad about my funded futures, every business has glitches, it’s more important how they are dealt with and in the case of my funded futures the response was perfect, thank you Stephanie and My Funded Futures.

reviews.title: Just take your money to topstep. Where you’re not penalized for silly things like I mentioned below. Embarrassing.
reviews.content: I recently had an issue with MFFU that left me disappointed. I was on vacation and didn’t trade much during that time, either on MFFU or my main prop firm, TopStep. Unlike TopStep, which I’ve been trading with for years, MFFU enforces a rule requiring traders to notify them if they won’t be trading—a rule I wasn’t aware of as a relatively new trader with the company.When I explained the situation and requested reinstatement, I hoped for some understanding, given my honest mistake. Unfortunately, my account was not reinstated.One of the reasons I decided to give MFFU a chance was the milestone program advertised by Matt on Twitter. While the idea sounded promising, my experience with this rule and the response I received has left me feeling dissatisfied.While I appreciate firms with clear policies, it would be helpful if MFFU better communicated these expectations upfront to newer traders. This situation has made me grateful that I didn’t invest the full $445 in this program and has ultimately led me to take my business elsewhere.

reviews.title: Patience and Understanding...
reviews.content: It is easy to identify why MyFundedFutures got these 1-star ratings. They appear to have been written by disgruntled customers. People who did not get the outcome they wanted. I almost became one of those disheartened and bitter clients but thanks to the patience and understanding of @Nathan | Lead, I had a different experience.After passing the evaluation, nothing worked when I tried to pay the activation fee. The card that was used to purchase the account, and was saved on the account, failed. I reached out to support who offered all the standard responses… “get in touch with your bank”, “try a different card”, “try a different browser”, “try using crypto”, blah, blah, blah. While all legitimate options, nothing worked. This went on for over 1 week so you can imagine how someone can get irate and disgruntled. The ticket was escalated, I jumped in their discord, but no one seem to be able to offer anything more than to ask me to “please be patient”. Patience” The one thing that EVERY trader must have and often is the one thing most traders lack”.Another week later, my ticket was picked up by Nathan and through his investigation we learned that my account was restricted because I had 2 accounts, which was a violation of their TOS (who knew). Nathan could easily have said, “You should have read the TOS. Ignorance is not bliss”, “You violated our TOS so go goodbye”. Instead, he worked with me and I was able to activate the account.MyFundedFutures is receiving a 5-star rating because Nathan was patient and understanding. Sometimes, as a customer, we need to realize that we are dealing with another person on the other side of the support chat, and we should also be patient and understanding. Thank you, Nathan, and MyFundedFutures.

reviews.title: Best in the Industry
reviews.content: - Best value for money prop firm accounts with no activation fees, and able to pass within one day.- $2500 drawdown on a 50k account compared to $2000 with other Propfirms and no activation fee is hard to beat.- Scary fast payouts within minutes.- Super friendly & understanding customer support. I asked to pause my sim funded accounts from christmas till first week of January to fully enjoy some quality time with my family, refocus for the new year, take a mental break from trading (which is important), which got approved with no issues.- 4 payouts so far, not even once was there any issues or tricky emails giving stupid reasons as to why my payout cant be processed like with other propfirms once you request a payout. Only change I would recommend or ask for is to be able to trade more than 3 SIM Funded Accounts other than that I just hope this Propfirm stays alive.

reviews.title: The Truth About MFF
reviews.content: I am going to give a very honest and thorough review. I am someone who is not a seasoned trader and often have issues sticking with my plans. The rules that MFF has in place put a vast majority of traders in a position where they have to abide by their rules. They have to stick to great risk management, and demonstrate their skill and ability. A lot of rules can seem tedious and annoying, but MFF helps shape you into a better trader in my honest opinion. I have not been able to obtain a payout yet, but would like to shed light on a recent scenario that demonstrates the professionalism and integrity of MFF. I was accidentally charged with auto renewals on some of my accounts, the issue could have been mine and most likely was. However, I requested a refund and within minutes I was approved. Furthermore, Kyle reached out to me on a SUNDAY EVENING to confirm that this was a mistake and that there is no reason to worry. I am someone who spent a great deal of time trying to figure out which prop firm is the best... etc etc... After the time I have spent with MFF, I am able to confidently say that their rules are very thorough, and create discipline, and proper risk management for those who do not have it prior to working with them. I wish you all luck in your endeavors. No skilled trader will ever complain about MFF, and me being a trader with little skill, I can confidently say that MFF rules are not the reason behind why I have ever failed a challenge account. Great support, caring for their customers. Most the negative reviews are butthurt people who can't trade well AND can't come to terms with the fact that they cannot trade well. Thanks Kyle, for your support.

reviews.title: Don't try to consider using them…
reviews.content: Don't try to consider using them because they are full of different rules and fees that they will not inform you in the beginning, and then later they will start to introduce them so that they can keep demanding more funds from you.  Avoid them at all costs. Choosing to move on with PAIVA has been the best decision so far.

reviews.title: PROBLEM Professionally Sorted!!
reviews.content: PROBLEM: Today, I purchased a $100K MFF Evaluation Account. To use Tradingview, I selected Tradeovate as a trading platform.  When everything was set up, I realised (unlike the case with Volumetrica) that I could not access the trading platform from the MFF dashboard.                               SIGNIFICANCE:                                        The importance of this problem was that I needed to gain the convenience and ease of the Volumetrica trading platform, which is integrated into the MFF Dashboard.                                              RESOLUTION: I reached out to MMF for assistance. ADE was personable and highly professional. He effortlessly initiated the process of cancelling and refunding my account - he promised a resolution time of between 1 and 2 Hours. Before the 2 hours was up, Emmanuel (seamlesly took over from ADE) messaged and emailed confirming cancellation and refund of the account. Then, I could buy a new account and choose Volumetrica Trading Platform.                      CUSTOMER FEELING: I have given these two guys and MFF a 5-Star rating. Excellent.  Keep it up.

reviews.title: Support promised I'd be able to reset my 25k Milestone and didn't uphold their promise
reviews.content: I took advantage of the opportunity to purchase 25k Milestone accounts during the month of November. I reached out to their Support so that I could understand if there would be a deadline on reseting the account and they assured me that I would be able to be reset it at any time. Either their Support has no idea what they are talking about or they changed their policy to protect their bottom line. I reached out to Support again today when I was unable to reset my accounts (keep in mind November isn't even over and they have pulled the plug on their 25k accounts) and was given varying answers. Most recently Support told me that it "wasn't" possible to reset Milestone accounts. Oh really? How interesting. So will I be refunded for the 25k accounts that I purchased and was promised I would be able to reset? Or on the resets that supposedly aren't possible but were purchased? When you are going to enter into an agreement with a prop firm it is really important that you can feel confident that they will do what they say. Keep their promises. They said they would offer the Milestone accounts for the month of November. They told me I would be able to reset the account. They failed to honor what they said not once but twice.

reviews.title: Microscalping rule.
reviews.content: While reviewing your regulations, I came across the Microscalping rule. As a futures scalper, I am quite concerned about this.My trading strategy involves taking long positions, and if the price rises, I place a stop loss at or slightly above the purchase price. If the price continues to rise, I take profits at higher levels. However, the issue arises when the price increases but then reverses, triggering my stop loss one or two ticks above the entry price. In this scenario, it seems that my trades would be in violation of the Microscalping rule.This trading method is fundamental to minimizing losses and maximizing profits in scalping. If I am not allowed to use this strategy, I won't be able to maximize my profits.Are you suggesting that I should forgo placing stop losses at my entry price and instead absorb losses of $200 to $300?This rule essentially instructs futures traders to disregard a key trading principle. I am very disappointed to learn about the existence of such a rule.

reviews.title: Outcome after a data feed issue ...
reviews.content: I experienced a major data issue which resulted in an unexpected loss. I reached out to customer support and while the replies weren't instant, they were certainly timely. My true and honest dismay comes from the uphill battle it was to reach a reasonable solution. Thankfully I journal and video record EVERY trading session, but despite submitting video proof, trading platform logs, and pointing to the exact phantom orders on the Tradovate CSV file, I was politely reminded that they are not liable for platform issues. Nevertheless, an agreement was reached and a credit was offered. While it's refreshing to see another company in the space take 'some' responsibility, I'm troubled to think what would happened to a newer trader that perhaps doesn't know how to explain a system log or how same size orders, at the same price, but opposing positions are not possible in an open market ... or a trader that simply doesn't record or journal all trades through independent software.It should also be understood by traders and PropFirms that we can call Tradovate 'reliable' until we all acknowledge that it doesn't take more than a simple google search to see the amount of issues Tradovate has had over the years. Just this year alone, during early summer '24, Tradovate had a major black out ... some PropFirms took responsibility and others didn't. Knowing that this is NOT uncommon, issues should be handled on the case by case basis and not rely on 'boiler plate' language and say "we're not liable." -- if you're not willing to stand by a platform you offer, then don't offer it or offer another. While issues exist everywhere, when overwhelming proof and evidence is presented, a better approach should be considered. Using boiler plate language, giving templated answers, and thinking one heavily worded user agreement, will solve all, will simply result in pages of 1-3 star reviews. Overall I'm satisfied with what I feel is a reasonable outcome, but will proceed cautiously knowing the effort it took to get us on the same page.

reviews.title: Unfortunately disappointed.
reviews.content: Unfortunately this review comes with good, bad, and worse. I have been with MFFU for several months now and I have good experiences and bad. Let’s be the worst out the way. So multiple new accounts I have bought in the first instance always engage in issues, whether it be not placing stop loses or take profits, to entering multiple contracts. Another serious problem which happens on any account, new, old, challenge or funded is when you set your SL or TP and it actually works, it is never what you place the order. For example, my usual SL is $100, multiple times with screen recordings it has exit at 150, 300, even 500. My take profits also exit less than my order set. MFFU claim these are “platform” issues and have no liability. It’s a coincidence how on my APEX account I never have this issue. I bought a new challenge today, I showed support the issue and showed no open trades, I then not 10 minutes after checked again and a position had opened itself and I was -630. apparently nothing they can do.I then did a test trade as advised, which saw everything fine but SL hit which saw the account go to daily drawdown. Again apparently nothing they can do.This comes as a massive shock as I’ve spent over £1000 with MFFU and they know problems are there but fail to want to take responsibility even when the same issues are persistent across different accounts. That said there has been an occasion where they why have reset 2 accounts out of “courtesy” as they call it.Genuine Traders need a consistent firm without the hassle, and to say across APEX accounts and my personal account I never EVER have any of these issues. I also have people in my discord that only have similar issues with MFFU so it’s safe to say it’s not only myself.

reviews.title: My Funded Futures is a breath of fresh air in the prop firm space
reviews.content: Where do Begin? I am a full-time trader and have been a prop firm trader for a good portion of my career. This means I was highly unprofitable for a long time like many others until I wasn't.One of my biggest gripes with the prop firm space is that they take an already difficult career path and multiply its difficulty through vague rules, delayed and denied payouts as well as systematic issues that highly favor the 'house' while alienating the trader.I have delayed this review while I got a good feel for My Funded Futures and I want to let all traders know that Matt Leech has created something special. No, you cant trade 20 accounts and no you dont go straight to funded. But you are getting clearly communicated rules, super helpful support and discord mod/IT team, and transparency.They are focused on taking traders to LIVE, paying them along the way, and building alongside you. I spent the summer stressed and frustrated trying to pry payouts from another firm that seemed to constantly move the goal post and it almost brought me to the point of ruin.I am thankful that MFF gave me a hand when I needed it most by simply being a GREAT prop firm. I have had multiple payouts all approved and sent within MINUTES and while I have experienced a few support issues. I received tremendous support from the entire team. Shout out to Joel IT and Ben MOD for taking their time and being super helpful day in and day out.Thanks MFF!

reviews.content: Bottom one is the original story and here is the update.------------------------------------------------------------On Oct 2, Gabrielo, Head of Customer Relations in MyFundedFutures reached out to me and provided an alternative to slove my issue. The whole communication and process is quick and smooth, and my KYC has finally verified today.I also requested for payout and it's been approved and paid in one hour! Fantastic!I'd like to share my full experience beacuse I found out that MFF is a great company who values customers a lot. We all understand there's growing pain, as long as our issues can be solved, we will follow you all the time. Thank you Gabrielo, thank you MFF. -----------------------------------------------------------Everything seems to be ok until it comes to payout. I have 3 starter accounts, after i met the payout requirement, I conducted the KYC process. I provided what it asked for but the result says "Unfortunately, we couldn’t verify you". Something related to verify my residency. I uploaded my passport for identification and tried to use driver's license & utility bill & tax letter for verifying address. How can the verification be failed? I submitted the ticket for help, the cs was quick but she can't help, she had to send it to upper management for General Escalation. It's been over 10 days and I did not receive any response. Be careful to try out this company, and if you do want to try, make sure to do the KYC first thing when you get the funded accounts. Otherwise, you will be like me, trying so hard to earn the profits but can't take it out.
reviews.reply_content: Hi, Yes, we require everyone to successfully complete basic KYC.

reviews.title: Worst prop firm
reviews.content: Worst prop firm. Had a funded account that was a few thousand in profit. Took trades while I was logged out. Hit DLL. Then CONTINUED to take trades. Contacted support. They said it had to be my fault and I had to have left orders open. Not true as my setting are OCO.  I kept asking how would it be my fault if the account was taking trades after it was supposed to have triggered DLL and been locked. They never answered the question. Gave them another chance and got a 100k eval. When I placed my trades they would not register on the platform until I logged out and in AFTER placing them. So I had a blind position until I logged out and back in. Explained this to them as well and again this is somehow my fault. This pales in comparison to Topstep and Apex customer support who are much more understanding of platform glitches and do not try and dishonestly take people’s money for unnecessary resets due to glitches on SIM FUNDED accounts that cost them exactly $0 to manage.

reviews.title: Outstanding prop firm, 5 stars
reviews.content: First of all, like so many other reviews I have to praise the customer service; absolutely outstanding.  I hear a lot of complaints about other prop firms, from cumbersome rules to delaying payments.  Mffu makes trading really smooth, there are very few rules, and the ones they have are easy to follow…things like don’t trade news events for 6 minutes before or after…any 1 day can’t represent 40% or more of your payout amount, no micro scalping…Today I qualified for my first payout, it took a few minutes to sign up for their company that processes the payments, but literally from the moment I clicked request payout until the moment it was in my bank account was less than 3 hours.  Fast!  This company is the real deal folks. 5 stars.

reviews.title: daily loss limit
reviews.content: 01/04/25: I like them.  Quick payouts and no hassle.  They are trustworthy!!!So far, it's been okay, although I haven't requested a payout yet. I'm on the Starter account, which has an automatic daily loss limit of $1200. However, the system didn't stop my trading until I reached a $1900 loss, just $100 shy of depleting the account, leaving me with almost no margin for drawdown. I wasn't trading on news, and the last news release occurred 90 minutes prior.Essentially, this account may as well be blown because My trailing drawdown for tomorrow will be between $50 to $100.  I've opened a ticket so I hope to resolve this issue; hopefully, they will make things right.13/09/24: After a few mixed message, MFF have resolved the issue.  So well done to them.16/09/24: I was told it would be resolved by the EOD on the 13th.  The issue is still outstanding.19/09/24:  The issue is still outstanding.23/09/24: Resolved to my satisfaction

reviews.title: Well I wish I had good things to say…
reviews.content: Update 09/10/2024    Account restored and balance returned. I very happy that it worked out. Considered it took over 4 weeks of some high stress to accomplish. I will adjust this rating but I have to be fair and say that if I did not persist in this, I don't think any fix would have happened. With that in mind, I will adjust to a neutral score. I will update if I can get this back to a payout. Update 09/08/2024    Well I may have some positive news here... The CEO of MFFU was made aware of my situation and customer service reached out to me about restoring my account along with the proper balance. I'm super excited that this problem may be fixed soon. Once my account is restored and I see it with my own eyes, I will change this review rating for sure. Fingers crossed...   Paul Well I wish I had good things to say about this company. It started out completely fine and I had one payout after trading for a few months. But after that that's where everything went off the rails. On my second payment I requested I was told that I violated a scalping rule. I completely understood and decided to make changes to my trading process to fit the rules. But here is where the problem starts the money I requested in made was forfeited and completely removed from my balance equity. I opened up a support ticket asking about this. It has been 4 weeks and not one person has responded even though I consistently ask and chat, discord and email. I gave it some time and decided to go back and trade this account again which I did and made it back to a payout. I requested payout number two and it was rejected immediately and my account was closed for inactivity. I had specifically asked support if I should trade the account while I wait to have my money returned from payout number one and of course never received any answer. Approximately a week went by before I resumed trading again. This has been the worst customer experience that I've ever had in my entire life. No one can explain to me what happened to my payout money and now I'm sitting with my accounts completely closed for breach of inactivity along with rejected payouts. This is the first time in 3 years I've actually had to reach out and talk to my bank, credit card company and file a complaint. This could have all easily been resolved with a simple email or message to me and the money returned back to my balance and now this is what has happened. My credit card company has urged me to file a police report after I gave them all my evidence. As a retired police officer I know when I should be capturing all emails, chats, discord and pictures. I was able to give the fraud department plenty of evidence. It is a shame that it came to this but I never give up and will continue to pursue this until I get an answer from someone. As far as I'm concerned my two payouts totaling $2,830 is missing and stolen.

reviews.title: False advertisement, bad customer service
reviews.content: Update 9/18: They have FINALLY taken the post down, acknowledging that it should have been this whole time. More people signed up thinking they got a promotion they never received and they are STILL doing zero to rectify it. It's scummy and I'm warning you now.   I wish I could post pictures, would make this easier to prove and see.  This company claimed to run a promo for a free reset for ALL first time DXfeed purchases.  It's  all over the place.  Still up and active right now on their official instagram page and more.  I purchased a new account using the code they provided, MFFU, failed the challenge, and contacted customer service to get the reset code.  Only to be told they ended it on August 31st with ZERO notice or notification to new customers.  Again, its still up right now on their socials with no end date anywhere in sight.  I've given them PLENTY of money failing challenges on the Tradovate side, to see them be so short and unwilling to work with me when I chatted in was the end of giving them money.  I can NOT recommend them anymore after that interaction, and I was a fan.

reviews.title: Disappointing Support and Misleading Platform Advertisement
reviews.content: Choose your platform very carefully.All over, OK firm. But customer service definitely needs improvements.I chose MyFundedFutures because of their promising features and their claim that they provide Quantower for trading. As a volume trader, I heavily rely on volume analysis tools like footprint charts, volume profile, and VWAP for my strategy. Naturally, I opted for Quantower when purchasing my challenge, only to find out later that they do not actually provide a license for the platform, making these essential tools inaccessible.Despite this, I managed to pass my challenge using an alternative platform (Volumetrica web) that allowed me to continue my volume analysis. Now that I have a funded account, I need to trade effectively, and without proper access to volume tools, this is impossible. I’ve spent hours in support chats trying to resolve this issue, but the responses I received were disappointing at best. The support agents often don’t read my messages properly, and their replies are vague and nonsensical, failing to address my concerns.My request for a platform change has been consistently ignored, despite the fact that MyFundedFutures’ advertising misled me into choosing Quantower. This is not just a minor inconvenience—it directly impacts my ability to trade. I’ve been patient and courteous in all my interactions, yet I have not received any real assistance.I’m writing this review with the hope that someone from top management will see it and take immediate action. MyFundedFutures needs to provide accurate information about the platforms they offer and ensure that support is responsive and helpful, especially when traders are relying on these tools for their success.If you’re a volume trader or depend on specific tools, please be cautious when considering this service. I sincerely hope MyFundedFutures takes this seriously and resolves this ongoing issue.NOTEI'm adding this comment as I wait for the support. I'm on chat now for the last 7 hours. My chat has been transferred to 6 agents as of now and all are asking the same questions, suggesting the same workaround (which doesn't work) and stop responding. Waiting for the 7th agent.

reviews.title: First off support is pretty much non…
reviews.content: First off support is pretty much non existent now even though they advertise 6mins or something false. They are having issues with people not being able to get paid out waiting more than a week and no response. Send a message to support or ask for help they say wait you, you wait and no answer until you ask again and again and again. They big tradovate issues 8/26. 8/27 and still people are having problems they also never sent out email or notifications to anyone about issue so if you ran into a problem tough luck or try to prove it! (proof doesn't get you anything here also even with screenshots or video) They are good at answering questions about paying for evaluations and taking your money but when it comes to needing help or fixing the problem for the community they say its all our fault never and issue on their end its always some other issue besides them and working with the other company to fix it. They talk a good game just like all the prop firms out there when you see the ceo have so much time to post on twitter or sit around in a chair on youtube you know they not working for you or care for you. Don't get me wrong mffu was decent before but when issues arise among the traders they are barely there to help out. I've waited hours and days with no response from support patiently waiting like they said and when someone answers its like a new person asking your problem all over again. Endless loop of support and trying to get things resolved and when they say they do resolve something they don't compensate for the problems that arose.

reviews.title: Very shady rules, won’t commit to an answer.
reviews.content: I have seen a Youtube video about people getting denied payouts and having their profits confiscated by MFF for doing what they call “micro scalping”.  They don’t hide this and it is listed in their help section, however it’s an unfair and loosely defined term. I asked MFF help staff what exactly micro scalping is?  What is the minimum amount of ticks I am allowed to set my brackets to?  What is the minimum time I must hold my trades for?  How am I supposed to time my trades when the market can move suddenly anytime it wants to?  How many trades in a short time frame is too many?  What is a short time frame?  Etc.  They couldn’t answer any of my questions.  Literally none of them.  I think it’s only fair to have the rules laid out clearly, so that traders know what they are allowed to do, and what they are signing up for.  It’s not fair to deny someone a payout for breaching their nonsensical, loosely defined rules.  Too many trades in a short time frame, but can’t say how many is too many and for how long a time frame.  Is it 20 trades an hour, or 2 trades a day, or 1 trade a week?  It’s laughable. Same for the brackets - how many times do you enter a trade and it turns against you?  You may have a profit target of $500, but the market goes up to $400 then turns around.  If you’re smart you won’t let a winning trade turn into a loser, so will have moved your stop close to breakeven.  You get stopped out at an arbitrary amount, say $10.  Is this micro scalping?Or what if your $500 gets hit in seconds?  Could easily happen in a busy time, then you’ve broken the short time rule and your payout gets denied. I won’t go near them until they have some proper, professional rules.

reviews.title: Don't agree to their terms and conditions - it is set up for you to fail. Legally. The only thing you can do to protect your capital is not agree.
reviews.content: Legal "scam". They sell the dream, but their Terms of Services roughly states that if your account magically suffers a large loss they are not responsible. They don't state that you are, but they state that they are not.Rithmic as a service provide just places so-called "ghost trades" on your account. LOOK IT UP ON YOUTUBE!!!! These ghost trades are trading activities not initiated by you, or executed in a random way, not as you prepared it. Many firms selling prop-firm challenges were affected by this, not only MFFU. Yet there is a global and silent consensus across all prop-firms, that if enough peoiple complain within a short amount of time, thten they must act and fix the ghost trades. If not, you just lost your account and according to ther Terms you are not eligeble for any compensation. They don't  have, and they will not proivide any proof that you placed the trades that caused the loss on the account. You just lose your investment and can go ahead to perform a sort of a self-performed activity that is widely regarded as very pleasant.I posted proof of this on their Discord server and my message was immediately deleted. Hence, their social media is heavily censored and does not represent the factual truth and opinion of EVERYONE involved, as my opinion/experience was instantly erased. Can it be called a scam? I believe not, legally not at least. Why? Because you sign the Terms of Servicwe, which I did. I agreed with a very bad taste of outh, predicting that this TOS will be used against me, but going for the dream made me risk it. Was a mistake. So, to wrap it up. Is MFFU a scam? Legally not, but their Terms of Service you must agree to in order to use the services is skewed to protect them against issues that they should be held responsible for. Think about it this way:  they state that if Rithmic fails, they are not responsible, so you can't take it or leave it, you must take it (the error in Rithmic's side). Period. Are you going to contact Rithmic? Nope, you are not a customer of Rithmic, hence they will not attend you. Get it? Do yourself a favor and forget every single "prop firm." Study about bucket-shops and how they operated during the pre-elctronic era, and see if you can find anything similar. I'm not saying MFFU is a bucket-shop broker as they aren't even a broker, so that would be a silly claim, but you get the idea. Do your own research. I lost money, so you don't have to. Fund your own account and trade micros, you're better off.

reviews.title: HUGE DECEPTION
reviews.content: I purchased 3 150K challenges on 04/24, completed the challenges then received my 3 funded accounts activated on 04/26.So far everything is perfect. Responsive on the creation of funded accounts, really cool Dashboard!I do my job, everything is going well and finally reach the 14 days to be eligible for payments.The day after day 14, I do my KYC verification, create my RISEWORKS account and the payment button on the dashboard works. Everything is fine ! The payment request is displayed on the dashboard with the status “waiting for payment”.It’s after that that everything gets complicated…I wait until the day after the 3 working days, as specified in their payment policy. But still no progress. I open a request in the chat to find out what's going on and make sure there are no problems. So I am asked to wait, until the Risk Team is contacted following my request. The next day still no progress. I contact support again and they tell me that my request is transferred to the Finance Team and that I will have a response from them within 24 hours. The next day, still no response... I then decided to follow up on the chat: significantly less responsive, no response for several hours. I ask what are the reasons for this delay: no response to date… I also sent an email directly to support(at)myfundedfutures.com. No response either...Another reminder was made again on the chat and there I was asked what email address I gave to make my request. I therefore specify the address, which is the same as for my MFFU account and my RISE account, the same address on which I received my challenge account codes, financed, ... Now it is the Tech team which takes charge my file…I was wondering who the next team is!?All this to say that I clearly saw that they were trying to save time and today I know the reason: Payouts declined… (email from “Sage” of the support team on 05/18).They reimbursed me for all my purchases of challenge and funded accounts ($600), nice but it’s nothing compared to the $13,150…In complete transparency I will list the reasons for the refusal: “microscalping, an excessive number of trades, and inconsistent sizing”.Seeing this, distraught, I decided (on 05/20) to respond to Sage's email by asking the following questions regarding what I was accused of:Microscalping: What is your precise definition? Trade duration per position?Excessive number of trades: Please specify your limit.Inconsistent sizing: How much variation in the number of contracts between different trades do you allow? Is there a calculation rule? In my opinion it is impossible to NEVER vary your exposure. Even on a single asset. The market is never identical day after day, does not necessarily have the same volatility and therefore requires adapting its exposure, i.e. the number of contracts.in the refusal email from Sage, I am reminded of two links which lead to their rules policy. What I am accused of appears vaguely in the second link. Why not ? Even if I think that these non-precise rules do not allow traders to be able to defend their arguments in the event of a dispute.Except that this second link in question concerns “EXPERT” type accounts. Except that for my part, I have bought 3 "STARTER" type challenges...So I am being denied my payouts for reasons that do not concern me!!Since 05/20 I have had no response from MFFU...I am completely incomprehensible. And I have no way to get things done…However I am honest, I can show absolutely all the details of my accounts and exchanges with MFFU, trading journal...Julien C.A simple trader who did his job according to the rules explained to him
reviews.reply_content: Hi Julien, It appears that your account fell under the microscalping restriction as a result of your trades persistently targeting less than 5 ticks. This is something we do not allow. We thank you for the feedback and wish you well on your trading journey. Thanks,

reviews.title: My first day with My Funded Futures
reviews.content: Last week I  purchased starter pack $150k evaluation and selected Rithmic platform. I thought I could use my Rithmic credentials on my Ninatrader platform (The platform that I've been using since 2014). Unfortunately I could not login Ninjatrader. I emailed to Myfundedfutures customer service and I requested them to either change the platform from Rithmic or refund my money and then I'll purchase a new evaluation account and this time select Ninjatrader. Spidy from customer service team was very prompt, kind and helpfull to resolve the matter and I received the refund the same day. Today I purchased a new starter pack $150k evaluation and selected Tradovate which is the same company as Ninjatrader. I've logged to my Ninjatrader platform using Tradovate credentials from Myfundedfutures and I traded at US cash open. Fortunately I reached the profit target of $9,237 (required $9,000) and I expect to move to the funded stage from tomorrow. I'm satisfied customer so far. I'll update my experience with Myfundedfutures after I start trading with funded account, make my first withdrawal.

reviews.title: If I could give zero stars
reviews.content: If I could give zero stars, I would. I had over 5K in my funded account. I had a position open during FOMC minutes.(Not the rate decision). I made about $65 on that trade. THEY FAILED MY ACCOUNT BECAUSE OF THIS! 2 days later, they emailed me that my account was failed. I tried to protest, they would not give in. They even blocked me on twitter! How ridiculous? They claim to have great customer service and be the best prop firm out there. Apex/Topstep would not do this to a trader! This rule that you cannot have an open trade during fomc minutes is buried in their FAQ section. No warning, no second chance. They failed my account and I lost the entire $5-$6K because of this. This is a genuine first account review that happened to ME!I know now that it is prohibited. I guarantee you that most of your traders are unaware that if they trade during a JOBS REPORT, they will lose their account! Such a foolish rule. Perhaps you should lock all accounts during those few minutes of the release to prevent this. NOT FAIL LEGITIMATE TRADERS FOR BEING UNAWARE OF THIS RULE!!!!
reviews.reply_content: Hi, Tier 1 news events are prohibited. We have this rule listed on the website, the FAQ, the discord, and our team is available to assist in answering any confusing questions. We have a tier 1 news event calendar on the dashboard as well so you are easily able to see which events you can not trade. Thanks, MFFU Team

An option to not pay a funded activation fee..AMAZING (those can get pricy). Upfront cost for a combine is a bit more than others but this is good because it teaches you out the gate to not YOLO your trades. The discord group is helpful and welcoming and for once not toxic like others. The support staff when submitting tickets are equally as great. They focus on the problems that they can solve and crush it, people do not understand they are a prop firm and not the platform support lol. All in all great company, will be doing business with them for a long time.

reviews.title: Best customer experience ever!
reviews.content: I had a challenge buying a second account and one Fabio, head of customer relations advised me to reach out to him. He communicated that their card processor had suddenly stopped accepting cards from my country. He however didn't give up on me, he personally reached out to the CEO to talk to the card processor to unban my country. Eventually the ban was lifted and the card processor once again started accepting cards from my country. Fabio didn't stop there, due to this challenge he had promised that once the issue was resolved he would honor his promise of offering a discount that had already ended back in January to purchase an expert account. Well, he did exactly that and actually went a step further and sweeten the discount further from 24% to 30% due to the inconvenience caused. I honestly have never experienced this kind of personal and kind customer service from anyone before, leave alone any other prop firm. The fact that Fabio didn't just give up on me and personally followed up on this issue to the end until it was resolved, left a really positive taste on MFFU. Keep up the good work. And Fabio indeed deserves to be the Head of Customer Relations. He is really good at it.

reviews.title: Lack of transparency
reviews.content: In comparison to other futures prop firm the lack transparency. They don't have faq for some of the frequently faced issues.1. They did not have the reset cost explicitly in FAQ for all accounts. All they have mentioned is that reset could been done in the dashboard, that is after purchasing the evaluation account. I had to contact customer support for that. I went through all of their faq, before purchasing evaluation account, but I do agree that I did not pay attention to reset as such.2. They do not have the commission cost for buy and sell, to factor in for P&L of evaluation account. I had to contact customer support. 3. Sometimes customer support chat takes extra time in responding after beginning of chat conversations on both sides. I am okay with that. But I am mentioning here, because in the discord meet they used customer support as a marketing factor, saying they were better than most prop firms.4. 30k static account is removed from the website. You market about this account on all sides, and then remove it. If you marketed this account as one of industry's best account then why remove it. Why keep starter and expert accounts? Is it because of failure rate with trailing drawdown accounts? Although, MFFU has every right to do what they want. 5. Reset cost same as evaluation in static and expert account. Why would I want that? I can as well purchase a new evaluation for 30 days. 6. Profit target is high compared to other prop firms. For example for 100k EOD account - MFFU expert 8k, Uprofit 6k, TickTick 6k, Tradeday 5k.Positives1. Good expert and starter plans with all inclusive pricing. You can budget accordingly. Good idea to separate beginners from experienced traders.2. Variety of platform choice 3. Friendly professional customer chat support4. Nice looking functional dashboard5. They allow copy trading about 3 accounts. I have not done it. 6. Payouts - I have no experience
